meanings.sent1: She tried to delude her friend into thinking the sky was green.
meanings.sent2: The con artist attempted to delude the elderly couple into giving him their life savings.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to delude the audience into believing he could make a rabbit disappear.
meanings.sent4: His smooth words could delude even the most skeptical person.
meanings.sent5: The mirage in the desert deluded the travelers into thinking they had reached an oasis.

meanings.sent1: The prankster wanted to delude his friends by pretending to be a ghost.
meanings.sent2: The scammer was able to delude many people into buying fake products.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to delude the dog by hiding behind the curtains.
meanings.sent4: The clever disguise managed to delude the guards at the entrance.

meanings.definition: To give a false impression or belief
meanings.sent1: The mirror's reflection deluded her into thinking she had gained weight.
meanings.sent2: The haunted house decorations were so realistic, they deluded visitors into thinking they were in real danger.
meanings.sent3: The optical illusion was meant to delude the viewers into seeing something that wasn't there.
meanings.sent4: The fake smile could delude anyone into thinking she was happy.
meanings.sent5: The cleverly edited video was able to delude many into believing a fabricated story.
